content:
I apologize for the confusion in my previous response. Since the compression is being applied to two faces of the cell, the force distribution should be factored in accordingly.

The compression is applied by the steel plates on both the largest faces of the cell, which means the force exerted by the rods will be evenly distributed across both faces. The total force applied to the cell is still 300 kgf, and there are four rods. However, since there are two faces, we need to divide the force per rod by 2.

Force per rod (in kgf) = (300 kgf / 4) / 2
Force per rod (in kgf) = 75 kgf / 2
Force per rod (in kgf) = 37.5 kgf

Now, convert the force per rod to Newtons:

Force per rod (in Newtons) = 37.5 kgf \* 9.81 N/kgf
Force per rod (in Newtons) = 367.875 N

Since there are four rods, the total force applied to the cell is:

Total force (in Newtons) = 4 \* 367.875 N
Total force (in Newtons) = 1,471.5 N

The area of the largest face of the cell remains the same:

Area = 205mm \* 174mm
Area = 35,670 mm²

Convert the area to square meters for pressure calculation:

Area (in m²) = 35,670 mm² \* (1 m² / 1,000,000 mm²)
Area (in m²) = 0.03567 m²

Now, calculate the pressure applied to each face of the cell:

Pressure = Total force (in Newtons) / Area (in m²)
Pressure = 1,471.5 N / 0.03567 m²
Pressure ≈ 41,234.5 Pa (Pascals)

So, the pressure applied to each face of the cell is approximately 41,234.5 Pa. This accounts for the compression being applied to the two largest faces of the LiFePO4 battery cell.
